subject: Communication
title: Ekman's Six Universal Emotions
description: A short lesson to help you apply Ekman's Six Universal Emotions.

hook.text: Paul Ekman showed photos of faces to an isolated Papua New Guinea tribe. They recognized every emotion.

buildup.text: Six emotions produce universal facial expressions: happiness, sadness, anger, fear, surprise, and disgust.

discovery.text: Each emotion activates specific muscle combinations called 'action units' â€” measurable and consistent.

twist.text: A real smile uses the orbicularis oculi muscle around the eyes. A fake smile only moves the mouth.

climax.text: Ekman's Facial Action Coding System (FACS) maps every possible muscle movement in the human face.

punchline.text: Six emotions. One face. Every human on Earth.

quiz.question: Which muscle distinguishes a genuine smile from a fake one?
